R Bloggers

Understanding the 2013 Colorado Floods - #WorkWithData

Authors: Leah A. Wasser

Overview

  • Drought and Rain
    • Palmer Drought Index
  • The Impact of Rainfall
  • Stream Discharge data
  • Light Detection and Ranging
  • Imagery Showing changes in Lee Hill Road
  • A nice timeline of the events leading up to and during the flood:

In September 2013 a slow moving cold front moved through Colorado, intersecting with a warm humid front. The clash between the cold and warm fronts yielded heavy rain & devastating flooding in colorado.

images of the event here

Below - an animation of the storm front that triggered the 2013 Colorador floods.

Drought and Rain

Palmer Drought Index

Below is the palmer index from 1990 to 2015 for Colorado What are the patterns of drought observed in PA based upon this index?

  1. When did the Palmer index begin a positive cycle?
  2. Did the negative cycles coincide with the floods?

http://www7.ncdc.noaa.gov/CDO/CDODivisionalSelect.jsp#

The Impact of Rainfall

Background – what causes large rain events what is normal rainfal for a region is / how is rainfall changing?

Below is a plot of hourly precipitation between August 15 - October 15 2015. Explore the data and answer the following questions

  1. What dates were the highest precipitation values observed? What was the total precipitation on these days? What units is that value in?

Stream Discharge data

some background on stream discharge will go here..

Below, have a look at a static plot that shows stream discharge in Boulder Creek for 2013. What do you notice about the patterns of discharge seen in these data?

Light Detection and Ranging

Imagery Showing changes in Lee Hill Road
